title: Ticket #2626: Permit dprintf to log to something besides a file.
description:
The dprintf system currently can only write to a log file, or, assuming a developer sets a global variable, to standard out. A variety of groups have expressed interest in the ability to specify different output targets.

The current output targets beyond a file and the syntax for specifying them as follows (note that these WILL likely change, they are currently this way for prototyping purposes): 

  <1>: Standard out
  <2>: Standard error
  <OUTDBGSTR>: OutputDebugString function

The ultimate goal is to also include the ability to specify at the very least a pipe as well.
